alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 12:45AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Victoria County through 115 AM CST... At 1245 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brentwood Subdivision, or near Victoria, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Victoria, Guadalupe, Victoria Colony Creek Country Club, Wood Hi, Victoria Detar Hospital North, Victoria Riverside Park, Victoria College, Victoria Mall, Saxet Lakes, Brentwood Subdivision, Inez, Victoria Regional Airport, Telferner, Ball Airport Area and Downtown Victoria. This includes the following highways... US Highway 59 between mile markers 622 and 640. US Highway 77 between mile markers 572 and 576. US Highway 87 between mile markers 808 and 818. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
